```{python}
#| label: fig-country-trends
#| fig-cap: "Trends in Life Expectancy, GDP, and Population"

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

# 1. Load the data
df = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')

# 2. Filter for Botswana
target_country = 'Botswana'
country_df = df[df['country'] == target_country]

# 3. a multi-line chart or a specific trend chart
# plot Life Expectancy over the years
fig = px.line(country_df, 
              x="year", 
              y="life_expectancy", 
              title=f"Life Expectancy Trends in {target_country}",
              markers=True,
              labels={"year": "Year", "life_expectancy": "Life Expectancy (Years)"})

fig.show()

#GDP change
fig_gdp = px.bar(country_df, 
                 x="year", 
                 y="gdp_per_capita", 
                 title=f"GDP per Capita in {target_country} Over Time",
                 labels={"gdp_per_capita": "GDP per Capita", "year": "Year"})
fig_gdp.show()

#population change
fig_population = px.bar(country_df, 
                 x="year", 
                 y="population_millions", 
                 title=f"Population in {target_country} Over Time",
                 labels={"population": "Population", "year": "Year"})
fig_population.show()
```
